benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/customFields - Retrieve invoice item custom fields

covered: Valid Request: Multiple scenarios cover successful retrieval and assert 200 with a JSON array of CustomField objects (default NONE and explicit audit=FULL/MINIMAL).
Empty Response and Not Found: Invoice item with no custom fields returns an empty array; empty DB scenario and non-existent id returning 404 are covered.
Query Parameters: audit parameter behaviors are exercised (default NONE, FULL, MINIMAL), combinations tested, extra unsupported params are ignored, and invalid audit value is tested (400).
Path Parameter Validation: Valid vs invalid UUID format is tested (400 for invalid format) and missing id in path is addressed (404/400).
Error Handling: Negative/error scenarios for 400 (invalid id), 404 (not found), 503 (service/db or dependency failure), and 504 (timeout) are present.
Authorization & Security: Unauthorized access (401) is tested; SQL injection and XSS payloads in invoiceItemId are covered.
Performance & Scale: Large-volume custom fields and concurrency/performance tests are present; timeout behavior is included.
Regression & Backward Compatibility: Regression test for missing audit parameter and backward compatibility with older Accept header are included.
Response Structure & Accessibility: Response is validated as JSON and there is an accessibility check for descriptive field names.
gaps: Pagination: No tests cover pagination/partial-result handling (limit/offset or continuation links). Confirm whether the endpoint is paginated; if so, tests are missing.
Caching Behavior: No tests for caching headers or conditional GET behavior (ETag, If-None-Match, Cache-Control, Last-Modified, 304 responses).
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No explicit tests for rate limiting (429 Too Many Requests) or Retry-After behavior; concurrency tests do not validate throttling semantics.
Content-Type and Standard Headers: No explicit assertions that responses include Content-Type: application/json (and charset) or checks for other relevant headers (Content-Length, Cache-Control).
Schema Validation: Tests do not strictly validate each CustomField object against the API schema (required fields, data types, allowed enum values).
Audit Field Details: Tests assert presence/absence of audit information but do not assert exact audit field names/values/format for FULL vs MINIMAL.
Authorization scope / 403: Only 401 (missing/invalid token) is tested; there are no tests for 403 (insufficient privileges) if the API enforces role-based permissions.
Error Payload Standardization: Error responses are not validated against a consistent error schema (structured code/message fields).
recommendations: Confirm pagination: If the endpoint supports pagination, add tests for page size/limit/offset or continuation tokens, next/prev links, and correctness when iterating through a large dataset.
Add caching tests: Verify presence and format of ETag, Cache-Control, Last-Modified headers; test conditional GETs (If-None-Match / If-Modified-Since) and 304 responses.
Add rate-limiting tests: Generate bursts of requests to observe throttling behavior, assert 429 responses when limits are exceeded, and verify Retry-After header semantics.
Assert HTTP headers explicitly: Add checks that Content-Type is application/json (with expected charset) and validate other standard headers relevant to clients and caches.
Schema conformance tests: Validate each returned CustomField object against the API definition (required properties, types, enums), and fail if any element deviates.

Audit-detail assertions: For audit=FULL and audit=MINIMAL, assert presence and format of specific audit fields (e.g., createdBy, createdDate, updatedBy); for audit=NONE assert those fields are absent.
Add 403 scenarios: If KillBill supports scoped permissions, add tests for valid token but insufficient privileges returning 403.
Standardize error checks: Add assertions that error responses follow a consistent error payload (fields, codes, human-readable message) to make clients robust.

Harden negative tests: Add malformed/edge-case query parameter tests (e.g., repeated audit params, whitespace/case variations), very-long invoiceItemId values, and boundary tests for number of custom fields.
Document test data and setup/teardown: Ensure deterministic tests for large-volume, concurrency, and dependency-failure scenarios (seed data, mocks/stubs for external audit service).
